intro: Hippophae salicifolia subsp. yunnanensis, commonly known as the Yunnan sea buckthorn, is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of China. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, yellow-orange berries that are rich in vitamin C. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing at high altitudes. Its botanical features include a robust root system and a deciduous habit, adapting well to harsh climatic conditions. This subspecies is valued for its ecological role and potential economic uses.
